Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Develop your design and developmental skills

The Internet and emerging technology has transformed many areas of our lives including business, entertainment, education, broadening the Churchâ€™s reach to members and non-members alike around the world. Within this industry, there is a great need for professionals who can effectively use the latest technologies to design and develop professional interactive websites. Combining the interdisciplinary resources of the Art, Business Management, Communication, Computer Information Technology, and Computer Science departments, students may choose from a variety of integrated web design and development programs.

What are the classes like?

BYU-Idaho's online courses mirror campus courses. They follow the same semester format and use the learning model. Students will have regular due dates for assignments and should expect to interact with their instructors and peers often.

How long will this program take?

Our online degree program allows students the flexibility to finish their degree while balancing a busy life. Students who are just beginning their studies will be able to graduate with an A.S. in Web Design and Development as early as Fall 2014. Students who have completed their generals can begin taking major-specific upper division credits during the Winter 2013 semester.

Students can accelerate to graduation by taking classes all three semesters each year, or take a semester off when needed. Students must complete the program within four years.

What will I study?

  • Graphic Design
  • Typography
  • Web business
  • Programming
  • Web page development
  • Technology for professional writers

View all degree requirements in the University Catalog and check course availability.

Is this a good fit for me?

Where do I begin?

Students who meet the admission requirements can apply to be directly admitted into a online degree program. These students will start by taking the online orientation course, a one-credit course offered every block. This course prepares students to succeed online and charts a course to graduation. Pathway students who complete Academic Start do not need to take GS 111.

Have questions?

We're ready to talk! Call us at (866) 672-2984, or email us at onlinelearning@byui.edu, or text your question to (208) 557-4132.

*Notes when all classes will be available for a degree. Students may begin working on a program prior to this date if they plan on graduating on or after this date. Students who currently need upper division classes should choose another major.
